definition: high-sounding speech/bombast/high-profile
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
erhua variant of 唱高調|唱高调[chang4 gao1 diao4]

sentences.english: Other journals that had carried subsequent high-profile papers from Dr Potti behaved in similar ways.
sentences.chinese: 其它后来发表了波提博士高调论文的刊物也一样。

sentences.english: Mr Fini was ostensibly a high-minded mutineer.
sentences.chinese: 菲尼明显是一个高调的反叛者。

sentences.english: Feng's high-profile in entertainment industry is bound to bring into broad controversy.
sentences.chinese: 凤姐此次高调进军演艺界势必会带来争议。

sentences.english: The UK government proudly unveiled a shatterproof pint glass on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府于上周四高调推出一种防碎玻璃酒杯。

sentences.english: Russia also had launched recently a series of high-sounding talk activity in the Latin American area.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯最近在拉美地区也展开了一系列高调活动。

sentences.english: blares the cover of the latest issue of Time magazine.
sentences.chinese: 几个字高调出现在《时间》周刊的封面上。

sentences.english: This means you're talking high-sounding words or bushwa.
sentences.chinese: 唱高调就是说大话或者说空话。

sentences.english: Always the calm Jia Xiuquan unexpectedly so high-sounding talk, really makes one express admiration.
sentences.chinese: 一向沉稳的贾秀全竟然如此高调，实在令人称奇。

sentences.english: Glazing of high-profile, tentacle didn't touch the temperature.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃窗里的高调，触手碰不到的温度。

sentences.english: China aims high for plug-in EVs, but can it deliver?
sentences.chinese: 中国高调瞄准了充电式电动汽车，它能实现吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems are common to high-profile, visionary projects across China.
sentences.chinese: 有些问题普遍存在于中国的那些高调和宏大的项目中。

sentences.english: Marion Nestle, a high-profile professor of nutrition at New York University, agrees.
sentences.chinese: 马里昂雀巢的营养高调纽约大学教授对此表示赞同。

sentences.english: I know golden orioles trill in the trees, their melody reaching the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 我也知道树上有高鸣的黄鹂，唱著入云的高调。

sentences.english: He pitched the vote as a "call of history".
sentences.chinese: 他高调地称这次表决为“历史的召唤”。

sentences.english: Star snooker player Ding Junhui announced his comeback by winning his second UK Championship title.
sentences.chinese: 台球明星丁俊晖再次赢得英国锦标赛冠军，高调复出。

sentences.english: His chirping makes you deaf but the tune remains the same.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖声高调的声音让你耳聋，但声调始终保持不减。

definition: low pitch/quiet (voice)/subdued/low-key/low-profile
expert/scholar/mother earth/a type of green tea
generous/magnanimous/stylish/in good taste/easy-mannered/natural and relaxed
with great fanfare
to flaunt wealth/ostentatious
public/to publish/to make public
to show one's face/to appear (in public)
to steal the show/to grab the limelight
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
previously
to make a public display of affection
to support/to back
complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
